$$n\var(\bar X_n)=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{n}\cov(X_i,X_j)\\=
\sum_{|h|<n}(1-\frac{|h|}{n})\gamma(h)\leq \sum_{|h|<n}|\gamma(h)|$$\
If $\gamma(n) \to 0$ as $n \to \infty$ then
$\lim_{n \to \infty }\frac{1}{n}\sum_{|h|<n}|\gamma(h)|=2\lim_{n \to \infty }|\gamma(n)|=0$,
whence $\var[\bar X_n] \to 0$.\
If $\sum_{h=-\infty}^{\infty}|\gamma(h)|<\infty$ then the dominated
Convergence theorem gives
$$\lim_{n \to \infty }\sum_{|h|<n}(1-\frac{|h|}{n})\gamma(h)=\sum_{h=-\infty}^{\infty}\gamma(h)$$.
names: proof of mean square convergence of the sample mean of a stationary process
